trans-unit.source: Connect to Oracle Database or eBusiness Suite in a BizTalk Services Project
trans-unit.target: Connect to Oracle Database or eBusiness Suite in a BizTalk Services Project

trans-unit.source: There are three overall steps to connect to an Oracle database or Oracle eBusiness Suite application from a <token>af_integration</token> project.
trans-unit.target: There are three overall steps to connect to an Oracle database or Oracle eBusiness Suite application from a <token>af_integration</token> project.

trans-unit.source: Create an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle.
trans-unit.target: Create an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle.

trans-unit.source: To create an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle, you must be a member of the local Administrators group and have the System Administrator right on the on-premises Oracle system.
trans-unit.target: To create an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle, you must be a member of the local Administrators group and have the System Administrator right on the on-premises Oracle system.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio must be opened with Administrative privileges to use <token>lobconnect</token>.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio must be opened with Administrative privileges to use <token>lobconnect</token>.

trans-unit.source: Use the <token>lobtarget</token>
trans-unit.target: Use the <token>lobtarget</token>

trans-unit.source: Generate schema for the operation to be performed on Oracle.
trans-unit.target: Generate schema for the operation to be performed on Oracle.

trans-unit.source: These steps assume you have a <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: These steps assume you have a <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Install Azure BizTalk Services SDK</link> lists the requirements.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Install Azure BizTalk Services SDK</link> lists the requirements.

trans-unit.source: To add an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle
trans-unit.target: To add an <token>lobtarget</token> for Oracle

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, expand <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold>, expand the Management URL, and then expand <legacyBold>LOB Types</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, expand <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold>, expand the Management URL, and then expand <legacyBold>LOB Types</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click <legacyBold>Oracle DB</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>Oracle EBS</legacyBold> and select <legacyBold>Add Oracle Target</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <legacyBold>Oracle DB</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>Oracle EBS</legacyBold> and select <legacyBold>Add Oracle Target</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard opens:
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard opens:

trans-unit.source: In the Welcome window, select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the Welcome window, select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Connection Parameters, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In Connection Parameters, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Server</legacyBold>: The server name or IP address of the Oracle system and optionally, the port number.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Server</legacyBold>: The server name or IP address of the Oracle system and optionally, the port number.

trans-unit.source: If the port number is not entered, port 1521 is used.
trans-unit.target: If the port number is not entered, port 1521 is used.

trans-unit.source: To use a different port, enter <legacyItalic>ComputerName:PortNumber</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: To use a different port, enter <legacyItalic>ComputerName:PortNumber</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Service Name</legacyBold>: Required when Server is specified.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Service Name</legacyBold>: Required when Server is specified.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Advanced</legacyBold>: Select this button to configure additional Connection Properties and any Binding Properties:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Advanced</legacyBold>: Select this button to configure additional Connection Properties and any Binding Properties:

trans-unit.source: Port Number
trans-unit.target: Port Number

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Default is 1521, which is the typical Net Listener for Oracle.
trans-unit.target: Default is 1521, which is the typical Net Listener for Oracle.

trans-unit.source: ServerAddress
trans-unit.target: ServerAddress

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The name or the IP address of the Oracle server.
trans-unit.target: The name or the IP address of the Oracle server.

trans-unit.source: ServiceName
trans-unit.target: ServiceName

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Oracle service.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Oracle service.

trans-unit.source: ServiceType
trans-unit.target: ServiceType

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Default is <embeddedLabel>Dedicated</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Default is <embeddedLabel>Dedicated</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Dedicated
trans-unit.target: Dedicated

trans-unit.source: Uses a single server process to serve a single user process.
trans-unit.target: Uses a single server process to serve a single user process.

trans-unit.source: Shared
trans-unit.target: Shared

trans-unit.source: Uses a shared server process that can that can serve multiple user processes.
trans-unit.target: Uses a shared server process that can that can serve multiple user processes.

trans-unit.source: DataSourceName
trans-unit.target: DataSourceName

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>: The Oracle Transparent Network Substrate (TNS) network alias.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>: The Oracle Transparent Network Substrate (TNS) network alias.

trans-unit.source: If specifying the ServerAddress and ServiceName, do not enter a DataSource.
trans-unit.target: If specifying the ServerAddress and ServiceName, do not enter a DataSource.

trans-unit.source: If not specifying the ServerAddress and ServiceName, enter a DataSource.
trans-unit.target: If not specifying the ServerAddress and ServiceName, enter a DataSource.

trans-unit.source: The TNS network alias may be case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The TNS network alias may be case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: In the <legacyBold>Binding Properties</legacyBold> tab, refer to <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for Oracle Database Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228967</linkUri></externalLink> or <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for Oracle E-Business Suite Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228984</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: In the <legacyBold>Binding Properties</legacyBold> tab, refer to <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for Oracle Database Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228967</linkUri></externalLink> or <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for Oracle E-Business Suite Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228984</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>The Oracle Database Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228966</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>The Oracle E-Business Suite Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228983</linkUri></externalLink> provide additional information.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>The Oracle Database Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228966</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>The Oracle E-Business Suite Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228983</linkUri></externalLink> provide additional information.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Specify the credentials</legacyBold>: Enter the credentials to authenticate to the on-premises Oracle system.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Specify the credentials</legacyBold>: Enter the credentials to authenticate to the on-premises Oracle system.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Use Windows Credentials
trans-unit.target: Use Windows Credentials

trans-unit.source: The logged on user credentials are used to connect to the Oracle system.
trans-unit.target: The logged on user credentials are used to connect to the Oracle system.

trans-unit.source: Use the following UserName and Password:
trans-unit.target: Use the following UserName and Password:

trans-unit.source: Enter a <embeddedLabel>User name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Password</embeddedLabel> that can connect to the Oracle system.
trans-unit.target: Enter a <embeddedLabel>User name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Password</embeddedLabel> that can connect to the Oracle system.

trans-unit.source: User names in Oracle are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: User names in Oracle are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: For release 10g and earlier, passwords on the Oracle system are not case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: For release 10g and earlier, passwords on the Oracle system are not case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Not all options may be available for this LOB adapter.
trans-unit.target: Not all options may be available for this LOB adapter.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Operations, expand the node, select the database operations, and select the right arrow:
trans-unit.target: In Operations, expand the node, select the database operations, and select the right arrow:

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for Oracle Operations</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228968</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for Oracle E-Business Suite Operations</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228985</linkUri></externalLink> provide additional details on selecting an operation.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for Oracle Operations</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228968</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>Browsing, Searching, and Retrieving Metadata for Oracle E-Business Suite Operations</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228985</linkUri></externalLink> provide additional details on selecting an operation.

trans-unit.source: To see the operation’s generated WSDL, select the operation, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To see the operation’s generated WSDL, select the operation, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Runtime Security, enter the security type.
trans-unit.target: In Runtime Security, enter the security type.

trans-unit.source: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Fixed username
trans-unit.target: Fixed username

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: Custom SOAP Header
trans-unit.target: Custom SOAP Header

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.

trans-unit.source: Message Credential
trans-unit.target: Message Credential

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Deployment, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: In Deployment, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.
trans-unit.target: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.

trans-unit.source: There are restrictions based on the security model.
trans-unit.target: There are restrictions based on the security model.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use the Message Credential or Fixed Windows credential security type.
trans-unit.target: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use the Message Credential or Fixed Windows credential security type.

trans-unit.source: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>:
trans-unit.target: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>:

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter your <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: Enter your <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name is required.
trans-unit.target: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name is required.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Secret
trans-unit.target: Issuer Secret

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key is required.
trans-unit.target: A valid <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key is required.

trans-unit.source: Relay Path
trans-unit.target: Relay Path

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the desired name of the relay path.
trans-unit.target: Enter the desired name of the relay path.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you use chose Fixed Windows credential option for Runtime Security, you can enter something like <legacyItalic>WindowsAuthRelay</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you use chose Fixed Windows credential option for Runtime Security, you can enter something like <legacyItalic>WindowsAuthRelay</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Target Sub-path
trans-unit.target: Target Sub-path

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can enter <legacyItalic>GetOrder</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can enter <legacyItalic>GetOrder</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Target runtime URL
trans-unit.target: Target runtime URL

trans-unit.source: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path and target sub-path specified.
trans-unit.target: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path and target sub-path specified.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Summary shows your configured values.
trans-unit.target: Summary shows your configured values.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When complete, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When complete, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following activities occur in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following activities occur in the background:

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: Its configuration can also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Its configuration can also be exported.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.

trans-unit.source: To use the <token>lobtarget</token>
trans-unit.target: To use the <token>lobtarget</token>

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the relay endpoint in Server Explorer, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the relay endpoint in Server Explorer, and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select the security method you want to use, and enter their values.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select the security method you want to use, and enter their values.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.

trans-unit.source: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: The default value of the property is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: The default value of the property is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Open the .config file for the LOB target, which typically has the <legacyItalic>RelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> naming convention.
trans-unit.target: Open the .config file for the LOB target, which typically has the <legacyItalic>RelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> naming convention.

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the config file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the config file.

trans-unit.source: Once a <token>lobtarget</token> is configured and added to the design area, add a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token> to be the source.
trans-unit.target: Once a <token>lobtarget</token> is configured and added to the design area, add a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token> to be the source.

trans-unit.source: Use Connector in the Toolbox to connect the bridge to the lobtarget, similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Use Connector in the Toolbox to connect the bridge to the lobtarget, similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> provide more specific information on the <token>xml_bridge</token> and any additional properties that must be configured.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> provide more specific information on the <token>xml_bridge</token> and any additional properties that must be configured.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> property of the <token>lobtarget</token> to send messages to the on-premises LOB system.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> property of the <token>lobtarget</token> to send messages to the on-premises LOB system.

trans-unit.source: To generate the schema
trans-unit.target: To generate the schema

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the <token>lobtarget</token> you created, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to <legacyItalic><project_name></legacyItalic></embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the <token>lobtarget</token> you created, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to <legacyItalic><project_name></legacyItalic></embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Schema Generation</embeddedLabel> dialog opens.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Schema Generation</embeddedLabel> dialog opens.

trans-unit.source: Enter a file name prefix.
trans-unit.target: Enter a file name prefix.

trans-unit.source: This value is prefixed with all the schema files that are generated.
trans-unit.target: This value is prefixed with all the schema files that are generated.

trans-unit.source: You can also enter the folder name under which the schemas are added in the Visual Studio Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can also enter the folder name under which the schemas are added in the Visual Studio Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The default value for the folder is <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The default value for the folder is <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select a credential type to generate the schema, provided appropriate values for authentication, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a credential type to generate the schema, provided appropriate values for authentication, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schemas are added to the project under the folder name.
trans-unit.target: The schemas are added to the project under the folder name.
